intro: Sinosenecio yilingii, commonly known as the Yiling sinosenecio, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
